comments.body: I had to add a short pause before this task to get this task to pass. Perhaps add `retries: ...` or a pause task.

Like this?

```
  # now upload that certificate
  - name: upload certificates first time
    aws_acm:
      name_tag: "{{ item.name }}"
      <<: *aws_connection_info
      certificate: "{{ lookup('file', item.cert ) }}"
      private_key: "{{ lookup('file', item.priv_key ) }}"
      state: present 
    register: upload
    with_items: "{{ local_certs }}"
    until: upload is succeeded
    retries: 5
    delay: 10
 ```
Yeah, that looks like it would fix it. Thanks!

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +77,81 @@
  # now upload that certificate
  - name: upload certificates first time
    aws_acm:
      name_tag: "{{ item.name }}"

comments.body: use the "{{ resource_prefix }}" var as part of all the names. This makes it easy to identify which test created which resource and keeps different test runs from interfering with each other (because the tests are run in parallel in CI).
Ok. I just added it to the variable list, rather than the `name_tag` lines.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +21,25 @@    aws_acm:
      <<: *aws_connection_info
      name_tag: "{{ item.name }}"
      state: absent
    with_items: "{{ local_certs }}"

comments.body: This really does help a lot with readability, thanks very much @matt-telstra
